From Pewdiepie? Well the guy makes videos so it's natural he would make videos to handle the situation , right?
Wasn't just WSJ though was it? Just google Pewdiepie and all the outlets showing up at the top are responsible too. They're the ones who accelerated the whole thing.

Take this incident independently. Media outlets ran an unfair smear campaign on someone who didn't deserve it and people need to call them out.
It's not about "he hates the librul SJW media."

Outlets have said he compared Leslie Jones to Harambe in a vid where he asked a bot "What if Harambe was alive" and the bot returned a pic of Leslie Jones. They've written that his clothes and hair show his affinity to the alt right movement. They've taken clips from videos where he was making fun of people claiming he was a Nazi and used them to prove he is a Nazi. How is that fair, I ask you?

I'd be okay if they backfired. If people said he shouldn't have made those jokes, or to say those jokes were in poor taste. But WSJ and the accompanying outlets are making him out to be an alt-righter and a Nazi. I didn't look at his apology vids and then decide this. I'd seen the offending videos within minutes of him uploading them. As the whole story has progressed I've seen the unfair judgment he's received.
The media HAS intentionally smeared him. He maybe deserved a reaction but not this overblown campaign against him. What do you do when the media does that? He's called them out and now he's being chided for blaming the media as if he doesn't want to take any responsibility.
Agreed. Tagging this vid "YouTube drama" is inappropriate and trivialises the whole issue.
